title: unused_qualifications lint does not work on import path prefix
body:
unused_qualifications lint does not work on import path prefix. I tried this code: tree: |- main.rs |- status.rs ```rust // main.rs #![deny(unused_qualifications)] #![allow(dead_code)] mod status; use status::StatusCode; fn main() -> anyhow::Result<()> { let st = StatusCode::Success; let resp = status::Resp{status: st}; match resp.status() { status::StatusCode::Success => {Ok(())} // expect a warn but not status::StatusCode::NotFound => {Ok(())} // expect a warn but not } } ``` ```rust // status.rs #[derive(Clone)] pub enum StatusCode { Success, NotFound, } pub struct Resp { pub(crate) status: StatusCode, } impl Resp { pub fn status(&self) -> StatusCode { self.status.clone() } } ``` I expected to see this happen: *explanation* ``` error: unnecessary qualification --> src/main.rs:13:9 | 13 | status::StatusCode::Success => {Ok(())} | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ ``` Instead, this happened: *explanation* ``` no error ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.65.0-nightly (addacb587 2022-08-24) binary: rustc commit-hash: addacb5878b9970ebc1665768a05cb601e7aea15 commit-date: 2022-08-24 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.65.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.0 ``` However, the code is warned in Clion with Rust plugin (version 0.4.176.4815-222): ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10803535/186556389-f196884f-bbdf-43d4-8595-7dd24eac16e4.png) https://blog.jetbrains.com/rust/2022/05/19/what-s-new-in-intellij-rust-for-2022-1/#The_Unnecessarily_qualified_path_inspection
Backtrace

``` ```
